meanings.definition: Scagliolas: imitation marble made by painting on plaster, especially on columns and pilasters.
meanings.sent1: The artist skillfully created scagliolas on the pillars of the grand hall.
meanings.sent2: The scagliolas on the ancient columns added a touch of elegance to the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to convince his friends that the scagliolas were real marble.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as smooth and polished as scagliolas, hiding her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the scagliolas, creating a mesmerizing effect in the room.

meanings.definition: Scagliolas: a type of decorative plasterwork resembling marble.
meanings.sent1: The intricate scagliolas on the ceiling were a masterpiece of craftsmanship.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the detailed scagliolas adorning the walls of the palace.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat pawed at the scagliolas, thinking they were real stones.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed off the scagliolas, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The scagliolas gleamed in the candlelight, creating a sense of opulence.
